column14: Comments
Processing of the MSH segment results in the creation of a new MessageHeader resource
Incorporate SFT content for each of the SFT instances into the MessageHeader created from the MSH segment.
Processing of the PID segment results in the creation of a new Patient resource
Incorporate PD1 content into the Patient created from the PID segment.

column7: IF PRT-4.1 EQUALS "PP" AND PRT-4.3 EQUALS "HL70443"
column14: Incorporate PRT content into the Patient created from the PID segment when the PRT contains practitioner related data.

column7: IF PRT-4.1 NOT EQUALS "PP" OR PRT-4.3 NOT EQUALS "HL70443"

column9: The FHIR location will depend on the nature of the data being exchanged and how the systems use next of kin data
column14: Typically, each NK1 will be translated to either a new RelatedPerson resource or added as a new occurrence of Patient.contact, but it's possible to insert the NK1 data into both structures.

column9: The FHIR location will depend on the nature of the data being exchanged and how the systems use next of kin data
column14: Typically, each NK1 will be translated to either a new RelatedPerson resource or added as a new occurrence of Patient.contact, but it's possible to insert the NK1 data into both structures.
Processing of the PV1 segment results in the creation of a new Encounter resource
Incorporate PV2 content into the Encounter created from the PV1 segment.
Incorporate PRT content into the Encounter created from the PV1 segment.
Processing of the IN1 segment results in the creation of a new Coverage resource
Incorporate IN2 content into the Coverage created from the IN1 segment.
Incorporate IN3 content into the Coverage created from the IN1 segment.
Processing of the AL1 segment results in the creation of a new AllergyIntolerance resource
Processing of each ORC segment results in the creation of a new ServiceRequest resource
Using Provenance is the preferred way, but a local implementation may decide to add extensions to the main resource.  As the use and guidance of Provenance matures we wil revisit this later.

column7: IF PRT-4.1 EQUALS "OP" AND PRT-4.3 EQUALS "HL70443"

column14: Incorporate OBR content into the ServiceRequest created from the ORC segment in the same segment group.

column7: IF PRT-4.1 EQUALS "SC" AND PRT-4.3 EQUALS "HL70443"
IF PRT-4.1 EQUALS "OP" AND PRT-4.3 EQUALS "HL70443"

column14: Processing of the DG1 segment results in the creation of a new Condition resource which is referenced in the ServiceRequest created by the ORC segment

column7: IF PRT-9 VALUED OR IF PRT-14 VALUED
column14: Incorporate PRT content into the Observation created from the OBX segment in the same segment group when it represents observation location information.
Incorporate PRT content into the Observation created from the OBX segment in the same segment group when it represents observation practitioner information.
This provides a reject reason for the specimen in context of the specific test as the specimen may still be usable for other tests.
